Description of incident: A hacker accessed Zendesk information that was online.  Three clients who use Zendesk to store information had user lists downloaded by the hacker.  Users who contacted those clients for support may have had their email addresses and the subject lines of those email addresses accessed.UPDATE (02/22/2013): Tumblr, Twitter, and Pinterest were the affected clients. Twitter let users know that emails, phone numbers, Twitter usernames, and any other information that was provided to Twitter may have been exposed.  Passwords were not compromised.
